intro: Ebnerella humboldtii, commonly known as the Humboldt's sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands or along riverbanks. It has slender, triangular stems and produces small, three-ranked flowers in spike-like clusters. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
